-- runs_activity
	SELECT
		date,
		SUM(passed_count) AS passed_count,
		SUM(retest_count) AS retest_count,
		SUM(failed_count) AS failed_count,
		SUM(untested_count) AS untested_count,
		SUM(blocked_count) AS blocked_count,
		SUM(custom_status1_count) AS custom_status1_count,
		SUM(custom_status2_count) AS custom_status2_count,
		SUM(custom_status3_count) AS custom_status3_count,
		SUM(custom_status4_count) AS custom_status4_count,
		SUM(custom_status5_count) AS custom_status5_count,
		SUM(custom_status6_count) AS custom_status6_count,
		SUM(custom_status7_count) AS custom_status7_count
	FROM
		test_activities
	WHERE
		date
			BETWEEN 20240101 AND 20240903
		AND
			project_id = 8
		AND
			run_id IN (8271,7574,3898,3888,3887,3885,3858,3706,3705,3704,3702,3701,3551,3550,3542,3444,3397,3351,3350,3317,3316,3315,1321,232,171)
	GROUP BY
		date

SELECT *
FROM `statuses`
ORDER BY `display_order` ASC

-- runs_activities_range
	SELECT
		test_changes.id,
		test_changes.status_id,
		test_changes.created_on,
		test_changes.test_id,
		test_changes.user_id,
		test_changes.assignedto_id,
		test_changes.unassigned
	FROM
		test_changes
	FORCE INDEX(ix_test_changes_run_order)
	WHERE
		test_changes.run_id IN (8271,7574,3898,3888,3887,3885,3858,3706,3705,3704,3702,3701,3551,3550,3542,3444,3397,3351,3350,3317,3316,3315,1321,232,171) AND
		test_changes.is_selected = 1 AND
		test_changes.created_on BETWEEN 1704067200 AND 1725407999
	ORDER BY
		test_changes.created_on DESC
	LIMIT
		500

-- runs_activities_rels
	SELECT
		tests.id,
		tests.is_completed,
		cases.title
	FROM
		tests
	JOIN
		cases
			ON
		cases.id = tests.content_id
	WHERE
		tests.id IN (33592729)

-- forecasts_estimate
	SELECT
		 s.id,
		 COUNT(*) AS case_count,
		 COALESCE(SUM(CAST(c.estimate AS decimal(20))), 0) AS estimate,
		 COUNT(c.estimate) AS estimate_count,
		 COALESCE(SUM(CAST(c.estimate_forecast AS decimal(20) )), 0) AS forecast,
		 COUNT(estimate_forecast) AS forecast_count
	FROM
 		suites AS s
	LEFT JOIN
 		cases  AS c
  	ON
 		c.suite_id = s.id
	WHERE s.id = 1808

SELECT `id`
FROM `statuses`
WHERE (`is_final` = 1)

-- forecasts_progress
	SELECT
		id,
		(SELECT
			COUNT(*)
		FROM
			tests
		WHERE
			run_id = runs.id AND
			is_selected = 1) as test_count,
		(SELECT
			COUNT(*)
		FROM
			tests
		WHERE
			run_id = runs.id AND
			is_selected = 1 AND
			tests.status_id NOT IN (1,2,5,6,9)) as tests_todo,
		(SELECT
			COALESCE(SUM(estimate), 0)
		FROM
			tests
		JOIN
			cases
				ON
			cases.id = tests.content_id
		WHERE
			run_id = runs.id AND
			is_selected = 1) as estimate,
		(SELECT
			COALESCE(SUM(estimate), 0)
		FROM
			tests
		JOIN
			cases
				ON
			cases.id = tests.content_id
		WHERE
			run_id = runs.id AND
			is_selected = 1 AND
			tests.status_id NOT IN (1,2,5,6,9)) as estimate_todo,
		(SELECT
			COALESCE(SUM(estimate_forecast), 0)
		FROM
			tests
		JOIN
			cases
				ON
			cases.id = tests.content_id
		WHERE
			run_id = runs.id AND
			is_selected = 1 AND
			tests.status_id NOT IN (1,2,5,6,9)) as forecast_todo,
		(SELECT
			COUNT(*)
		FROM
			tests
		JOIN
			cases
				ON
			cases.id = tests.content_id
		WHERE
			run_id = runs.id AND
			is_selected = 1 AND
			tests.status_id NOT IN (1,2,5,6,9) AND
			estimate_forecast IS NULL) as forecast_todo_missing,
		(SELECT
			COALESCE(SUM(estimate_forecast), 0)
		FROM
			tests
		JOIN
			cases
				ON
			cases.id = tests.content_id
		WHERE
			run_id = runs.id AND
			is_selected = 1 AND
			tests.status_id IN (1,2,5,6,9)) as forecast_completed,
		(SELECT
			COUNT(*)
		FROM
			tests
		JOIN
			cases
				ON
			cases.id = tests.content_id
		WHERE
			run_id = runs.id AND
			is_selected = 1 AND
			tests.status_id IN (1,2,5,6,9) AND
			estimate_forecast IS NULL) as forecast_completed_missing,
		(SELECT
			COALESCE(SUM(elapsed), 0)
		FROM
			test_changes
		WHERE
			run_id = runs.id AND
			is_selected = 1) as elapsed
	FROM
		runs
	WHERE
		id = 8271
